title: 44 Best Housewarming Gifts to Get You Welcomed Back in 2025
description: From registry-worthy dishware to budget-friendly plants and accessories
author: Leah Muncy, Kristi Kellogg
excerpt: Looking for the best housewarming gifts? Check out our fave picks that say “congrats,” including towels, cutting boards, diffusers, glassware, and more!
text: The Best Housewarming Gifts Are Guaranteed to Get You Welcomed BackFrom registry-worthy dishware to budget-friendly plants and accessoriesPhotography by Lizzie Soufleris, Styled by Adrian Ababović All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Yes, the best housewarming gifts should ideally be useful, but that doesn't mean you should skimp on the charm and whimsy factor completely. Whether you’re bestowing something special upon a pal who’s moving into a new apartment or their first house, a vibe-enhancing and aesthetically-pleasing present goes a long way to make the place feel more like home (and an elevated home at that).With that in mind, we’ve rounded up the best housewarming gifts—many of which have blessed our own spaces—at different price points. You’ll find practical items such as weighted blankets, decorative pieces like chic candleholders, and from-the-heart gifts like houseplants for welcoming vibes (everyone loves a money tree!). Here are some of our absolute favorites for kicking off a whole new era of homeownership, domestic bliss, or rental freedom.Our Top Picks for the Best Housewarming GiftsBest Budget-Friendly Gift: Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Oil & Vinegar Set, $52Best Plant Gift: Money Tree Plant, $74Best Cozy Gift: Bearaby Cotton Napper, $249Best Gadget Gift: SMEG Slice Toaster, $200Best Cookware Gift: Made In Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven, $299Best Splurge: KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer, $350Browse According to Category:Gifts Under $50 | Gifts Under $100 | Splurge GiftsGifts Under $50Boy Smells Hinoki Fantôme CandleBoy Smells’ Hinoki Fantôme is a uniquely wood-based candle gift that will curate a warm and earthy vibe. Don't be surprised if this becomes the signature scent for their new abode.The Sill Mini OrchidBring good tidings to any new homeowner with a beautiful potted Phalaenopsis orchid. This one from The Sill is available in five different variations, though we suggest a yellow one to signify new beginnings, or a pink one meant to represent happiness and joy.Wildflower Monogram Notecard SetMark their move with beautiful custom stationary to make their new chapter that more official. If they’re big on the lost art of the letter and handwritten thank yous, bringing this to the housewarming party is a no-brainer.Victoria Cast Iron SkilletA cast-iron skillet is another highly giftable choice. This Amazon find is a bestseller, with thousands of rave reviews (and even a glowing endorsement from Epicurious).The Company Store Textured Stripe Napkins (Set of 4)You can’t go wrong with a set of cotton napkins, especially when they’re woven with go-with-everything stripes. These ones are yarn-dyed and prewashed, giving them a handmade feel that’ll only get softer with use.Beeswax Taper CandlesFor any dinner party on the calendar, beeswax taper candles are in order. Long-lasting and non-toxic, they complement a wide range of decor and have a sweet, subtle scent.The Mug by East ForkAfter a chaotic move, your friend might be left with mismatched drinkware. Give them a fresh start with a few of East Fork’s elegant 12-ounce mugs. Seen here in a deep wine hue, the set is also available in several other shades. (And there are matching bowls and plates, should you feel inclined to add on.)Catania Mango Wood Salt & Pepper MillThis Wicked-esque set of salt and pepper mills is the prettiest we’ve seen in a long time. The vibrant green salt mill and muted pink pepper mill are sold separately for the Glinda or Elphaba in your life, but really they’re better gifted together as a set.Ellepi Klizia 97 StaplerMade in Italy, this powder-coated stapler makes a practical, colorful addition to any home office. Colors include bright navy, mustard yellow, and kelly green.Toyo Y-350 Steel Mountain Tool BoxIt’s not often that we come across a tool box that is actually attractive. This model from Japanese brand Toyo is just the right size for essentials, from screwdrivers to levels to measuring tape.The Company Store Textured Stripe Tea TowelFor those who think dish towels are just a basic gift, think again. This one will win a few style points in their kitchen and help dry off the kitchenware thanks to its absorbent cotton base.CB2 Kira Hand Etched Martini GlassAfter moving to a new space, the bar cart might be screaming for updated glassware. These glasses will give espresso martinis added flair.Gifts Under $100Money Tree PlantHaving a money tree in your home is said to bring good luck—it’s a thoughtful gift that will be auspicious and brighten up any room. Plus it’s pet-friendly for acquaintances with furry friends.vase - 16 (2018) Screenprint by Antic-HamA bouquet is fail-safe when it comes to a great housewarming gift—but their favorite florals in artwork form on a gallery wall? Doubly meaningful.Rejuvenation Stafford Woven Round BasketA gorgeous basket can pull double duty as storage and decor and looks good just about everywhere. This high-quality find is a perfect housewarming gift on its own, or you can assemble it with your own custom touch by adding special treats. (Think a throw blanket and page-turning novel, a bottle of wine and wineglasses, or a cutting board and artisanal cheeses—anything goes!)Zia Pia Fantasia Galantino Olive OilImported olive oil always makes for a thoughtful gift—especially when it comes in a hand-painted ceramic vessel that's heirloom material.Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Olive Oil and Vinegar SetThis Le Creuset duo turns the kitchen staple into a pretty affair to adorn the counter. The stoneware set is finished with durable porcelain enamel that’s chip-, scratch-, and stain-resistant, and it features stainless-steel spouts.Le Creuset Stoneware French PressAny coffee enthusiast will treasure a high-quality French press, and we’re partial to this design from Le Creuset. Seen here in Caribbean blue, the kitchen must-have is also fetching in cherry and “artichaut” green.Rock Pool Dance Print by Moira FrithIf they’ve got empty walls to fill, a cheery watercolor print by artist Moira Frith makes an excellent gift. Some prints are inspired by her observations of the rock pools and shallow waters along the English coast, while other prints from the series feature playful botanicals and whimsical dancers.Gohar World Shell Napkin Ring SetPlay into their predilection for kitschy-chic decor with delicate shell napkin rings from Gohar World. Showing up with these will likely seal your invite to their upcoming dinner party.Alessi B Salt CastorAdding just a pinch of salt will feel very luxurious with Alessi’s perforated salt castor.Alessi Pulcina Stovetop Coffee MakerFeed their caffeine addiction with style by showing up to a housewarming with a sleek-looking coffee maker and a bag of their favorite French roast.Sophie Lou Jacobsen Spiral Nickel-Plated Coasters (Set of 4)Don’t underestimate the power of cool coasters in a home. Not only will this SLJ set help keep their coffee table free of pesky ring marks, but the spiral design will elevate the decor in modern style.Sabre Paris Bistrot Faux Horn Cutlery SetChannel a French cafe vibe with this elevated cutlery set from Parisian label Sabre.Splurge GiftsRails Cashmere Throw in AlabasterComfy blankets make trusty companions—no matter if your friend is a bookworm who's into hygge or binging Oscar-nominated films. This cashmere design from Rails is woven with a subtle checkered pattern for extra visual appeal.Acorn Lantern Portable Outdoor LampFor a new homeowner with a backyard space, look no further than this versatile lantern built for indoor and outdoor use. A lantern stand (available for purchased separately) transforms the fixture into a standing design.Mykonos Muse by Lizy ManolaNo list of the best housewarming gifts is complete without a statement coffee-table book. Mykonos Muse, from Assouline, is a best seller and one of out favorites. Aside from its striking cover, you'll love the wanderlust-inspiring images of the famed Greek Island that fill 300 glossy pages.Oyster PlateOyster Fridays, anyone? (IYKYK) This dishware looks like it was plucked right off of Gwyneth Paltrow's kitchen wall. This charmer will definitely get a ton of use.Diptyque Mimosa Reed DiffuserDiptyque’s Mimosa scent is inspired by the scent of mimosa flowers that bloom in the South of France: tart, slightly spicy, and citrusy. Paired with rattan reeds and a glass vase, it’s a new home gift that anyone will appreciate.Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)A weighted blanket is a thoughtful housewarming gift that might relieve some of the post-move stress. The Bearaby Cotton Napper is one of our favorite weighted blankets year after year, and you can get it in midnight blue, white, dark gray (pictured), light gray, and blush. It’s also available in velvet if your giftee likes things a bit more luxe.Smeg 2 Slice ToasterThey'll be able to get the perfect crunch on bread, bagels, and english muffins thanks to Smeg's aesthetically pleasing toaster that looks like something straight out of the Jetsons.Hand Sculpted Conch Shell Speaker by Lucy SchaefferFor the low-tech among us, here’s a conch-shaped sculpture that cradles their smartphone, amplifying its existing speaker. It doubles as a piece of art when not in use.KitchenAid Artisan Stand MixerThe KitchenAid Pro Mixer is definitely a splurge, but it does come recommended by just about every professional baker—and several AD editors. These mixers are heavy-duty countertop eye candy, and they come in just about every shade of the rainbow.Maison Balzac Green 'The Olive Bottle' CruetFor a luxe for less trick, add Trader Joe's EVOO into this whimsical olive-adorned container from Maison Balzac.Gohar World Silver-Tone Lemon Squeezers (Set of 3)We’re hooked on these bird- and fish-shaped lemon squeezers. They’re attractive enough to leave out on the bar or counter and to be a cheeky conversation piece during a dinner party.Our Place Always Pan 2.0The Always Pan is a favorite among our readers, and it is most definitely one of the best housewarming gifts we can think of, especially for foodies. This pan does everything: It fries, sautés, and steams, plus it’s nonstick and easy to clean.Cangshan HAKU Series Steak Knife SetFresh knives will have their new kitchen looking sharp, and this snazzy steak set is one of the absolute best knife sets. Each set comes with an oak wood box that fits into a drawer.Nespresso Essenza Mini Coffee and Espresso Machine by DeLonghiThe compact Nespresso Essenza Mini delivers café-quality espressos and lungos without taking up precious counter space. (You can check out all our favorite coffee makers in our guide to the best espresso machines.)Alessi Pepper MillA few cracks of fresh black pepper finish the dish—using Alessi’s elevated pepper mill, of course.Courant Catch:3 Wireless Phone Charging TrayA great gift for the entryway. html:
The Best Housewarming Gifts Are Guaranteed to Get You Welcomed Back

From registry-worthy dishware to budget-friendly plants and accessories

All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Yes, the best housewarming gifts should ideally be useful, but that doesn't mean you should skimp on the charm and whimsy factor completely. Whether you’re bestowing something special upon a pal who’s moving into a new apartment or their first house, a vibe-enhancing and aesthetically-pleasing present goes a long way to make the place feel more like home (and an elevated home at that).

With that in mind, we’ve rounded up the best housewarming gifts—many of which have blessed our own spaces—at different price points. You’ll find practical items such as weighted blankets, decorative pieces like chic candleholders, and from-the-heart gifts like houseplants for welcoming vibes (everyone loves a money tree!). Here are some of our absolute favorites for kicking off a whole new era of homeownership, domestic bliss, or rental freedom.

Our Top Picks for the Best Housewarming Gifts

  • Best Budget-Friendly Gift: Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Oil & Vinegar Set, $52
  • Best Plant Gift: Money Tree Plant, $74
  • Best Cozy Gift: Bearaby Cotton Napper, $249
  • Best Gadget Gift: SMEG Slice Toaster, $200
  • Best Cookware Gift: Made In Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven, $299
  • Best Splurge: KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer, $350

Browse According to Category:

Gifts Under $50 | Gifts Under $100 | Splurge Gifts

Gifts Under $50

Boy Smells Hinoki Fantôme Candle

Boy Smells’ Hinoki Fantôme is a uniquely wood-based candle gift that will curate a warm and earthy vibe. Don't be surprised if this becomes the signature scent for their new abode.

The Sill Mini Orchid

Bring good tidings to any new homeowner with a beautiful potted Phalaenopsis orchid. This one from The Sill is available in five different variations, though we suggest a yellow one to signify new beginnings, or a pink one meant to represent happiness and joy.

Wildflower Monogram Notecard Set

Mark their move with beautiful custom stationary to make their new chapter that more official. If they’re big on the lost art of the letter and handwritten thank yous, bringing this to the housewarming party is a no-brainer.

Victoria Cast Iron Skillet

A cast-iron skillet is another highly giftable choice. This Amazon find is a bestseller, with thousands of rave reviews (and even a glowing endorsement from Epicurious).

The Company Store Textured Stripe Napkins (Set of 4)

You can’t go wrong with a set of cotton napkins, especially when they’re woven with go-with-everything stripes. These ones are yarn-dyed and prewashed, giving them a handmade feel that’ll only get softer with use.

Beeswax Taper Candles

For any dinner party on the calendar, beeswax taper candles are in order. Long-lasting and non-toxic, they complement a wide range of decor and have a sweet, subtle scent.

The Mug by East Fork

After a chaotic move, your friend might be left with mismatched drinkware. Give them a fresh start with a few of East Fork’s elegant 12-ounce mugs. Seen here in a deep wine hue, the set is also available in several other shades. (And there are matching bowls and plates, should you feel inclined to add on.)

Catania Mango Wood Salt & Pepper Mill

This Wicked-esque set of salt and pepper mills is the prettiest we’ve seen in a long time. The vibrant green salt mill and muted pink pepper mill are sold separately for the Glinda or Elphaba in your life, but really they’re better gifted together as a set.

Ellepi Klizia 97 Stapler

Made in Italy, this powder-coated stapler makes a practical, colorful addition to any home office. Colors include bright navy, mustard yellow, and kelly green.

Toyo Y-350 Steel Mountain Tool Box

It’s not often that we come across a tool box that is actually attractive. This model from Japanese brand Toyo is just the right size for essentials, from screwdrivers to levels to measuring tape.

The Company Store Textured Stripe Tea Towel

For those who think dish towels are just a basic gift, think again. This one will win a few style points in their kitchen and help dry off the kitchenware thanks to its absorbent cotton base.

CB2 Kira Hand Etched Martini Glass

After moving to a new space, the bar cart might be screaming for updated glassware. These glasses will give espresso martinis added flair.

Gifts Under $100

Money Tree Plant

Having a money tree in your home is said to bring good luck—it’s a thoughtful gift that will be auspicious and brighten up any room. Plus it’s pet-friendly for acquaintances with furry friends.

vase - 16 (2018) Screenprint by Antic-Ham

A bouquet is fail-safe when it comes to a great housewarming gift—but their favorite florals in artwork form on a gallery wall? Doubly meaningful.

Rejuvenation Stafford Woven Round Basket

A gorgeous basket can pull double duty as storage and decor and looks good just about everywhere. This high-quality find is a perfect housewarming gift on its own, or you can assemble it with your own custom touch by adding special treats. (Think a throw blanket and page-turning novel, a bottle of wine and wineglasses, or a cutting board and artisanal cheeses—anything goes!)

Zia Pia Fantasia Galantino Olive Oil

Imported olive oil always makes for a thoughtful gift—especially when it comes in a hand-painted ceramic vessel that's heirloom material.

Le Creuset Signature Stoneware Olive Oil and Vinegar Set

This Le Creuset duo turns the kitchen staple into a pretty affair to adorn the counter. The stoneware set is finished with durable porcelain enamel that’s chip-, scratch-, and stain-resistant, and it features stainless-steel spouts.

Le Creuset Stoneware French Press

Any coffee enthusiast will treasure a high-quality French press, and we’re partial to this design from Le Creuset. Seen here in Caribbean blue, the kitchen must-have is also fetching in cherry and “artichaut” green.

Rock Pool Dance Print by Moira Frith

If they’ve got empty walls to fill, a cheery watercolor print by artist Moira Frith makes an excellent gift. Some prints are inspired by her observations of the rock pools and shallow waters along the English coast, while other prints from the series feature playful botanicals and whimsical dancers.

Gohar World Shell Napkin Ring Set

Play into their predilection for kitschy-chic decor with delicate shell napkin rings from Gohar World. Showing up with these will likely seal your invite to their upcoming dinner party.

Alessi B Salt Castor

Adding just a pinch of salt will feel very luxurious with Alessi’s perforated salt castor.

Alessi Pulcina Stovetop Coffee Maker

Feed their caffeine addiction with style by showing up to a housewarming with a sleek-looking coffee maker and a bag of their favorite French roast.

Sophie Lou Jacobsen Spiral Nickel-Plated Coasters (Set of 4)

Don’t underestimate the power of cool coasters in a home. Not only will this SLJ set help keep their coffee table free of pesky ring marks, but the spiral design will elevate the decor in modern style.

Sabre Paris Bistrot Faux Horn Cutlery Set

Channel a French cafe vibe with this elevated cutlery set from Parisian label Sabre.

Splurge Gifts

Rails Cashmere Throw in Alabaster

Comfy blankets make trusty companions—no matter if your friend is a bookworm who's into hygge or binging Oscar-nominated films. This cashmere design from Rails is woven with a subtle checkered pattern for extra visual appeal.

Acorn Lantern Portable Outdoor Lamp

For a new homeowner with a backyard space, look no further than this versatile lantern built for indoor and outdoor use. A lantern stand (available for purchased separately) transforms the fixture into a standing design.

Mykonos Muse by Lizy Manola

No list of the best housewarming gifts is complete without a statement coffee-table book. Mykonos Muse, from Assouline, is a best seller and one of out favorites. Aside from its striking cover, you'll love the wanderlust-inspiring images of the famed Greek Island that fill 300 glossy pages.

Oyster Plate

Oyster Fridays, anyone? (IYKYK) This dishware looks like it was plucked right off of Gwyneth Paltrow's kitchen wall. This charmer will definitely get a ton of use.

Diptyque Mimosa Reed Diffuser

Diptyque’s Mimosa scent is inspired by the scent of mimosa flowers that bloom in the South of France: tart, slightly spicy, and citrusy. Paired with rattan reeds and a glass vase, it’s a new home gift that anyone will appreciate.

Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)

A weighted blanket is a thoughtful housewarming gift that might relieve some of the post-move stress. The Bearaby Cotton Napper is one of our favorite weighted blankets year after year, and you can get it in midnight blue, white, dark gray (pictured), light gray, and blush. It’s also available in velvet if your giftee likes things a bit more luxe.

Smeg 2 Slice Toaster

They'll be able to get the perfect crunch on bread, bagels, and english muffins thanks to Smeg's aesthetically pleasing toaster that looks like something straight out of the Jetsons.

Hand Sculpted Conch Shell Speaker by Lucy Schaeffer

For the low-tech among us, here’s a conch-shaped sculpture that cradles their smartphone, amplifying its existing speaker. It doubles as a piece of art when not in use.

KitchenAid Artisan Stand Mixer

The KitchenAid Pro Mixer is definitely a splurge, but it does come recommended by just about every professional baker—and several AD editors. These mixers are heavy-duty countertop eye candy, and they come in just about every shade of the rainbow.

Maison Balzac Green 'The Olive Bottle' Cruet

For a luxe for less trick, add Trader Joe's EVOO into this whimsical olive-adorned container from Maison Balzac.

Gohar World Silver-Tone Lemon Squeezers (Set of 3)

We’re hooked on these bird- and fish-shaped lemon squeezers. They’re attractive enough to leave out on the bar or counter and to be a cheeky conversation piece during a dinner party.

Our Place Always Pan 2.0

The Always Pan is a favorite among our readers, and it is most definitely one of the best housewarming gifts we can think of, especially for foodies. This pan does everything: It fries, sautés, and steams, plus it’s nonstick and easy to clean.

Cangshan HAKU Series Steak Knife Set

Fresh knives will have their new kitchen looking sharp, and this snazzy steak set is one of the absolute best knife sets. With blades forged from 67 layers of Damascus steel complemented by African blackwood handles, these knives are designed equally for style and durability. Each set comes with an oak wood box that fits into a drawer.

Nespresso Essenza Mini Coffee and Espresso Machine by DeLonghi

The compact Nespresso Essenza Mini delivers café-quality espressos and lungos without taking up precious counter space. (You can check out all our favorite coffee makers in our guide to the best espresso machines.)

Alessi Pepper Mill

A few cracks of fresh black pepper finish the dish—using Alessi’s elevated pepper mill, of course.

Courant Catch:3 Wireless Phone Charging Tray

A great gift for the entryway. This sleek catchall tray keeps track of their keys while also charging devices like their phone. No more running out the door without a full battery.

Maison Balzac Iris Flutes (Set of 2)

Toast to the new space with these striking stemmed coupes. The 100% Borosilicate glass design was inspired by actual irises. Glassware this pretty demands to be displayed on an open shelf or bar cart!

Sophie Lou Jacobsen Cosmo Coupe (Set of 4)

For all the champagne toasts to come, SLJ's coupe set feels special enough to mark any big occasion or milestone.

CB2 Orcino Green Marble Fruit Bowl

Sure, this marble bowl is technically designated for fruit, but we think that it’d make anything—from sweets to rolls—look equally nice.

East Fork Glass Colorblock Serving Spoon Set

Serving up salads and main courses will feel very Alice in Wonderland, thanks to this striking spoon set.

    Formerly a staff writer at New York Magazine (and later an interior design assistant), Leah Muncy has been covering the best things you can buy on the internet for nearly half a decade. She lives in New York with her cat, Pony, and currently works on the creative team at ... Read more

    Kristi Kellogg has been a regular contributor to Architectural Digest since 2019. Her work also appears in Vogue, Teen Vogue, Brides, Glamour, Allure, Condé Nast Traveler, and Epicurious. Previously, she managed SEO and content strategy at Condé Nast and currently leads SEO at Charles Schwab. She lives in Ventura, California, with her husband and their three dogs. ... Read more
